instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Retina 12" Keyboard Source?
threads.message: Does anyone have a good source for these keyboards? I need some 2015's and can't find them anywhere. I'm in the U.S. so I would prefer something here, but international will work too. Thanks.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Retina 12" Keyboard Source?
threads.message: Still insanely expensive, and coming without the sleep sensor. :( Anything that is less than two years old is a bitch to find parts for as a common rule. The "new" style air came out in 2010, screens for the 11" weren't available until summer 2012, for the 13" until summer or fall 2013. It's just the way it works.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Retina 12" Keyboard Source?
threads.message: They are expensive and a bitch to change. I got all mine from China and they did come with sleep sensors.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Retina 12" Keyboard Source?
threads.message: Ok, thanks. Yeah, I've changed a few and it's not fun. Also had sleep sensors. I'm thankful they went back to screws, and that I have someone else to take all those screws out. I have an order in from China so we'll see how that goes.
